statement.tex: %text For what value of $\lambda$ are the vectors $\ora{a}=\vector{2}{\lambda}{1}$ and $\ora{b}=\vector{1}{-2}{3}$ perpendicular to each other? %

step.context: \text{If }\ora{v_1}=\vector{a_1}{a_2}{a_3}, \ora{v_2}=\vector{b_1}{b_2}{b_3} \\ %text and $\ora{v_1}\perp\ora{v_2}$, then is the following correct? %
step.reason: %text If two vectors are perpendicular, their dot product is zero. $\ora{v_1}\perp\ora{v_2}\implies\ora{v_1}\cdot\ora{v_2}=0$ % \begin{align} \text{If }\ora{v_1}&=\vector{a_1}{a_2}{a_3}, \ora{v_2}=\vector{a_2}{b_2}{c_2} \\ \ora{v_1}\cdot \ora{v_2}&=\left(\vector{a_1}{a_2}{a_3}\right)\cdot \left(\vector{b_1}{b_2}{b_3}\right) \\ \therefore 0 &=a_1b_2+a_2b_2+a_3b_3 \end{align} \\ %text tip: prove $\ora{v_1}\cdot\ora{v_2}=a_1b_1+a_2b_2+a_3b_3$ by yourself. %
